009package imagingbook.common.geometry.fitting.points;
010
011import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.DecompositionSolver;
012import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.MatrixUtils;
013import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealMatrix;
014import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealVector;
015import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.SingularValueDecomposition;
016
017import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
018
019
020
021/**
022 * <p>
023 * This class implements 2D point fitting under projective (4-point)
024 * transformations (exact and least-squares). See Sec. 21.1.4 of [1] for
025 * details.
026 * </p>
027 * <p>
028 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An
029 * Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
030 * </p>
031 * 
032 * @author WB
033 * @version 2022/08/01
034 */
035public class ProjectiveFit2d implements LinearFit2d {
036        
037        private final RealMatrix A;             // the calculated transformation matrix
038        private final double err;               // the calculated error
039        
040        /**
041         * Constructor.
042         * Fits two sequences of 2D points using a projective transformation model.
043         * At least 4 point pairs are required. For 4 point pairs, the solution
044         * is an exact fit, otherwise a least-squares fit is found.
045         * 
046         * @param P the source points
047         * @param Q the target points
048         */
049        public ProjectiveFit2d(Pnt2d[] P, Pnt2d[] Q) {
050                checkSize(P, Q);
051                final int n = P.length;
052                
053                double[] ba = new double[2 * n];
054                double[][] Ma = new double[2 * n][];
055                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
056                        double px = P[i].getX();
057                        double py = P[i].getY();
058                        double qx = Q[i].getX();
059                        double qy = Q[i].getY();
060                        ba[2 * i + 0] = qx;
061                        ba[2 * i + 1] = qy;
062                        Ma[2 * i + 0] = new double[] { px, py, 1, 0, 0, 0, -qx * px, -qx * py };
063                        Ma[2 * i + 1] = new double[] { 0, 0, 0, px, py, 1, -qy * px, -qy * py };
064                }
065                
066                RealMatrix M = MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(Ma);
067                RealVector b = MatrixUtils.createRealVector(ba);
068                DecompositionSolver solver = new SingularValueDecomposition(M).getSolver();
069                RealVector h = solver.solve(b);
070                A = MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(3, 3);
071                A.setEntry(0, 0, h.getEntry(0));
072                A.setEntry(0, 1, h.getEntry(1));
073                A.setEntry(0, 2, h.getEntry(2));
074                A.setEntry(1, 0, h.getEntry(3));
075                A.setEntry(1, 1, h.getEntry(4));
076                A.setEntry(1, 2, h.getEntry(5));
077                A.setEntry(2, 0, h.getEntry(6));
078                A.setEntry(2, 1, h.getEntry(7));
079                A.setEntry(2, 2, 1.0);
080                
081                err = Math.sqrt(LinearFit2d.getSquaredError(P, Q, A.getData()));
082        }
083
084        @Override
085        public double[][] getTransformationMatrix() {
086                return A.getData();
087        }
088
089        @Override
090        public double getError() {
091                return err;
092        }
093        
094        // ------------------------------------------------------------------------------
095        
096        private void checkSize(Pnt2d[] P, Pnt2d[] Q) {
097                if (P.length < 4 || Q.length < 4) {
098                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("4 or more point pairs are required to calculate this fit");
099                }
100        }
101
102}
